Brief instructions for making observations in all parts of the world as also, for collecting, preserving, and sending over natural things : being an attempt to settle an universal correspondence for the advancement of knowledg both natural and civil / drawn up at the request of a person of honour and presented to the Royal Society. Woodward, John, 1665-1728.
[4], 20 p.
Printed for Richard Wilkin ..., London : 1696.
Written by John Woodward. Cf. DNB. Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.
=======

Woodward, John, 1665-1728.
